meanings.definition: To add too much spice to something.
meanings.sent1: She overspices the soup every time, making it too spicy to eat.
meanings.sent2: I hope you don't overspices the curry like last time; it was too hot!
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overspices the stew, turning it into a fiery inferno.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overspices her dishes is like adding fuel to a fire.
meanings.sent5: The warning label on the spice jar reminded her not to overspices her meals.

meanings.definition: Excessive use of spices in cooking.
meanings.sent1: The overspices in the dish overwhelmed the other flavors.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a pinch of each spice, but she added an overspices.
meanings.sent3: The overspices in the chili made it taste more like potpourri than food.
meanings.sent4: The overspices in her cooking turned her kitchen into a fragrant spice bazaar.
meanings.sent5: The overspices in the curry left a lingering burn on their taste buds.
